Article.ArticleTitle: Importance of incorporating standardized, verifiable, objective metrics of OPO performance into discussions about organ allocation.

Abstract.AbstractText: Identifying and supporting specific organ procurement organizations (OPOs) with the greatest opportunity to increase donation rates could significantly increase the number of organs available for transplant. Accomplishing this is complicated by current SRTR/CMS metrics of donation rates and OPO performance that rely on eligible deaths. These data are self-reported, unverifiable, and have been shown to underestimate potential organ donors. We examine the limitations of current OPO performance/donation metrics to inform discussions related to strategies to increase donation. We propose changing to a simple, verifiable, and uniformly applied donation metric. This would allow the transplant community to: 1) better understand inherent differences in donor availability based on geography, and 2) identify underperforming areas that would benefit from systems improvement agreements to increase donation rates.
